channel.title: Pages on PRC2
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on PRC2

item.title: Tips
item.description: Table of ContentsJava StyleWhere have you put your Curly Braces.Javadoc styleAdding your own code templates to NetBeans IDEMavenMaven RepositoriesMaven SettingsSebipom 3.0.3Sebipom and Java FXUsing the SeBiPom in your own projectsUpgrade all projects with one commandMaven on Steroids or: use it properlyMaven ModulesFlex Your Java MusclesConcepts usedSetting in startup scriptSwitching to other Java versionAll made simple with aliasesJava StyleJava is a language (sort of anyway) and languages come with a culture. One such cultural aspect is the way you format your code, like placing your brackets, parenthesis, spaces and curly braces.

item.title: Setup
item.description: Table of ContentsGetting StartedSetting up the correct environmentInstall JavaMake Java available on the PATHInstall Apache MavenInstall or update your IDESubversionConfiguring MavenSebipom 3.0.3Sebipom and Java FXUsing the SeBiPom in your own projectsUpgrade all projects with one commandAdditional PointersGetting StartedTo work successfully with the programs needed for PRC2, you need to install them first. Properly installing Java and other programs is not hard but must be done precisely. What will follow is a description on how to do that under Ubuntu Linux, macOS and Windows.
